definition: head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Lay your heads together and see if you can think out a scheme.
sentences.chinese: 你们碰头看看能否想出个计划。

sentences.english: You want to have a status meeting every day?
sentences.chinese: 你每天都想开一次碰头会。

sentences.english: The first thing they did when they started work every day was to have a brief meeting.
sentences.chinese: 他们每天上班的头一项工作，就是要举行碰头会。

sentences.english: The meeting was over in thirty-five minutes.
sentences.chinese: 他们的碰头三十五分钟就结束了。

sentences.english: The door was held open by a doorstop.
sentences.chinese: 那门用了门碰头，一直开着。

sentences.english: The door was held open by a doorstop .
sentences.chinese: 那门用了门碰头，一直开著。

sentences.english: Yes, I could meet you just after 10.
My uncle and aunt and I were to go together; and the others were to meet us at the church.
sentences.chinese: 舅父母跟我一块儿去的，别的人都约定在教堂里碰头。

sentences.english: When we met in the street the houses had grown somber.
sentences.chinese: 大伙儿在街上碰头时，四周的房子都已黯淡下来。

sentences.english: Thank you for your hospitality. I look forward to meeting your general manager.
sentences.chinese: 感激你们的美意约请，我也等候着与总司理老师碰头。

sentences.english: Jon meets Liz and tells her Odie and Garfield have been gone.
sentences.chinese: 乔恩与莉兹碰头后告诉了她奥迪和加菲都失踪了。

sentences.english: Her first question was “What exactly does the phrase ‘pre-meeting meeting’ mean?”
sentences.chinese: 她第一个问题是“‘预先碰头会’到底是什么意思？”

sentences.english: One night, a gang of robbers met together just outside the elephant shed.
sentences.chinese: 一天晚上，一伙强盗刚好在象棚外碰头。

sentences.english: About one month later, Germont came back to see us.
sentences.chinese: 一个月之后，热尔芒特回来和我们碰头。

sentences.english: He left work, and met me at the Motor Vehicle place, which is a 20 mile drive.
sentences.chinese: 他离开了单位，驾车到20里地外的车管所和我碰头。

sentences.english: We both roared with laughter, our heads together.

definition: to meet/to run into (sb)/to get together (with sb)
to meet/to rendezvous/to merge/to link up/meeting/confluence
to agree/to decide after consultation/to come to a compromise
to arrange an interview/an appointment (with the foreign ambassador)
to hold a meeting/to attend a meeting
to go on a journey/to leave
to leave in stealth/to slip away
